result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Worthless check. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Barber

records.addlTxt: Added attorney fees assessment.  Printed all assessments still owing and sent that to the defendant with a reminder notice on this case and a payment plan form.
for Payment

for Payment

*sent to Judge for review/signature*

Petition for Payment of Adversary Counsel Fees

*sent to Judge for review*

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation: Amend to Cty Ord Issue Worthless Check.  $143.80 forf; $73.50 ICSO service fee; $85 restitution.  Restitution was paid directly to DAs office and therefore does not need to be on the JOC.  Atty Angel enters guilty plea.    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark A. Barber in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for additional time before sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Mark A. Barber in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Mark A. Barber in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant vacated.  Bond previously signed continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Mark A. Barber in court,via video, and in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant does not intend to retain counsel.  $100 signature bond - standard conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
